titles.title: Digimon Universe: Appli Monsters
デジモンユニバース アプリモンスターズ
Digimon Universe: App Monsters
Digimon Universe: APP Monsters
数码兽宇宙 应用怪兽

anime.description: Everyone in the world uses smartphone apps. But inside them lurks unknown creatures called "Appli Monsters," or "Appmon." The Appmon are AI lifeforms with the ability to think and act, and exist in the boundary between the human world and digital space. In the vast sea of the internet, the "last boss AI" Leviathan takes control of the Appmon with a virus and begins hacking every system, thus starting to control the human world from the world of the net. Haru Shinkai is led to acquire the Appli Drive, and uses it to materialize Gatchmon, a search app monster. Source: ANN

externalentity.identifier: デジモンユニバース_アプリモンスターズ

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: kodomo
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, the word kodomo refers to a children`s audience roughly for the ages 12 and younger. In Japanese, the word means simply "child", and has no anime/manga-related connotations at all. It does not comprise a style or a genre per se, but rather indicates the publisher`s intended target demographic.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: proxy battles
tag.description: In our terms, a proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode. Often the training aspect is also involved, or in some cases the proxies are nothing more than holographic representatives of some other variation of competition (like for example a card game). While many popular shounen anime fit under this category, it`s not limited to shounen anime.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: 仮装のキミをうぃただきます! キャメラモンのハロウィンスキャンダル!
I`ll Get You and Your Disguise Too! Cameramon`s Halloween Scandal!
Kasou no Kimi o Uitadakimasu! Cameramon no Halloween Scandal!
episode.summary: Halloween is in town! While Haru is busy reading, Gatchmon heads out on his own. What`s with the picture that gets sent to Haru`s smartphone? What`s going on in the city?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 育てたキャラがスッポンポン!? ロープレモンの学校ダンジョン!
The Character I Leveled Up Is Naked?! Ropuremon`s School Dungeon!
Sodateta Chara ga Supponpon!? Ropelemon no Gakkou Dungeon!
episode.summary: A popular smartphone RPG`s data is getting erased, so that players` hard-leveled characters end up in their birthday suits! Meanwhile, interfaces across the city are starting to act like they`re part of the game! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: あやしき道先案内人! 拙者ナビモンでござる!
The Suspicious Travel Guide! Navimon I Am!
Ayashiki Michi Saki Annainin! Sessha Nabimon de Gozaru!
episode.summary: The navigation apps people use to get around town are going haywire! Where`s everyone going?! And could an Appmon be behind this?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 検索結果は新海ハル! ガッチモンあらわる!
Search Result: Shinkai Haru! Gatchmon Appears!
Kensaku Kekka wa Shinkai Haru! Gacchimon Arawaru!
episode.summary: Shinkai Haru is an ordinary first year in middle school. But one day, the search app Appmon, Gatchmon, jumps out of his phone! Who`d have thought that there were App Monsters living inside your smartphone?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Ending 1
Opening 1
大ピンチで超ノレねえ!? アストラのおもしろ動画大作戦!
A So Not Groovy Disaster?! Astora`s Funny Video Plan!
Dai Pinch de Chou Norenee!? Astra no Omoshiro Douga Daisakusen!
episode.summary: A powerful rival to Astora appears! Astora`s own funny videos start getting lots of dislikes... which leads to a fight with Musimon?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 3つ目のアプリドライヴ! 虎次郎はアプチューバー!
The Third App Drive! Torajiro Is an AppTuber!
Mittsume no Appli Drive! Torajirou wa Up Tuber!
episode.summary: Asuka Torajiro, AKA Astora, is a popular AppTuber on a video streaming site. But is that... an App Drive appearing in one of his funny videos? Could he be an App Driver too?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最高のグルメレポート! グルメアプリ・ペロリモン!
The Ultimate Restaurant Report! Dining App Perorimon!
Saikou no Gourmet Report! Gourmet Appli Perorimon!
episode.summary: Eri gets a gig as a restaurant reviewer, but it turns out she`s not very good at it! For advice, she seeks out a mysterious figure behind a popular food review app, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: あなたのハートにドッカンパンチ! エリはアプモンアイドル!
A Big Bang Punch Straight to Your Heart! Eri`s an Appmon Idol!
Anata no Heart ni Dokkan Punch! Eri wa Apumon Idol!
episode.summary: Haru assumed he had the only App Drive in the world, but then he sees one fall out of newcomer idol Karan Eri`s bag! They go to the TV studio to find out the truth, but security is strict! What`s the plan, Haru?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: サクシモン 超アプリンクで打ち破れ!
Fighting Sakusimon Let`s Use a Super Applink to Smack Him Right Down!
Sakushimon: Chou Uplink de Uchiyabure!
episode.summary: The one who saves Haru and the others from Sakushimon`s attack is... Rei?! But isn`t he an enemy? Rei faces Sakushimon solo to try to retrieve his little brother Hajime! But what does Haru do next?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ネットの海にダイブせよ! スーパーハッカーレイを追え!
Dive in to the Sea of the `Net! Follow the Super Hacker, Rei!
Net no Umi ni Dive Seyo! Super Hacker Rei o Oe!
episode.summary: The mysterious hacker Rei and Hackmon appear, and all of Haru`s Seven Code Appmon get stolen! They`ll have to dive into the sea of the `net and get them back! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アプモンたちのあこがれ! 伝説のセブンコード会!
The Dream of All Appmon: The Legendary Seven Code Meetup!
Appmon-tachi no Akogare! Densetsu no Seven Code Kai!
episode.summary: Mailmon arrives with an invitation to the "Seven Code Meetup"! Ropuremon and Gomimon head out with everyone! But doesn`t it seem like Mailmon is acting strange...? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: めざせ格付けナンバーワン! アプモン選手権 イン サイバーアリーナ!
Aim for Number One! Appmon Championship in Cyber Arena!
Mezase Kakuzuke Number One! Apmon Senshuken in Cyber Arena!
episode.summary: It`s a grand rally for all the Appmon who`ve appeared so far! The Appmon ranking tournament begins, featuring... a 100 meter dash, karuta, and a portrait competition?! Who will be declared the ultimate Appmon?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クリスマスが消えちゃった! 暦泥棒カレンダモン!
Christmas Disappeared?! Date Thief Calendamon!
Christmas ga Kiechatta! Koyomi Dorobou Calendarmon!
episode.summary: The dates of December 24th and 25th disappear from smartphone calendars worldwide! Ai is despondent at the thought that the Kashinoki Books Christmas celebration might not go through. But just then, Gatchmon sees something! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 『トキ』を超えたメッセージ アプリドライヴの真実
A Message from Across `Time!` The Truth of the App Drives!
"Toki"o Koeta Message: Appli Drive no Shinjitsu
episode.summary: At last, the secret of the App Drives comes out! The one who called to Haru from the App Drive turns out to be a very unexpected person! And where does a certain picture lead them? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 未来は全部見えている!? 神秘の占い・テラーモン
You See the Whole Future?! The Mysterious Divinator, Tellermon!
Mirai wa Zenbu Mieteiru!? Shinpi no Uranai Telamon
episode.summary: The team visits the fortune-telling app Appmon, Tellermon, to find the location of the next Seven Code Appmon! But when Tellermon is infected with the L-Virus... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 街中がパズルゲーム!? パズルモン大暴走!
The City-Wide Puzzle Game?! Puzzlemon`s Rampage!
Machijuu ga Puzzle Game!? Puzzlemon Daibousou!
episode.summary: Haru and his friends enjoy writing New Year`s resolutions. Meanwhile, out in the city, chaos breaks out when puzzle games start appearing on screen displays! The screens won`t work unless you solve the puzzle... what do we do?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Ending 2
さよならアストラ!? ドリーモンの悪夢!
Farewell, Astora?! Dreammon`s Nightmare!
Sayonara Asutora!? Dreamon no Akumu!
episode.summary: Astora`s going to train for two years?! While he struggles over whether to pursue his dream as a YouTuber, Dreammon presents him with a choice. Meanwhile, his father fails to return from his daily workout... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ネットの海が大ピンチ! 『トキ』は来た, 極アプ合体!!
The Sea of the `Net in Trouble! The `Time` Has Come: Ultimate App Fusion!
Net no Umi ga Dai Pinch! "Toki" wa Kita, Kyoku App Gattai!!
episode.summary: It`s Valentine`s Day in the city, but everyone`s smartphones are in danger! Updating Waffle OS, the operating system used by 70% of the world`s phones, is causing them to freeze up and die... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハルと勇仁の絆 止めろ! 暴走レッシャモン!
Haru and Yujin`s Bond. Stop the Rampaging Resshamon!
Haru to Yuujin no Kizuna: Tomero! Bousou Resshamon!
episode.summary: L-Corp`s newest GPS game is a worldwide hit, and players converge on a seaside park searching for a super rare treasure! Haru and friends try to find it, too, but Resshamon causes a runaway train panic! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: エリがコピペで大増殖!? とりもどせ, 夢のステージ!
Eri`s Copy-Pasted Everywhere? Restore the Dream Concert!
Eri ga Copy-Pa de Dai Zoushoku!? Torimodose, Yume no Stage!
episode.summary: The Fujimizaka New Year Festival will feature a guest performance by Karan Eri of Appliyama 470! But Copipemon works some mischief to fill the town with Eri videos! Will the concert to celebrate her new CD be canceled?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 超巨大コメットモン襲来!? 扉をひらけ, ダンテモン!
The Massive Cometmon`s Attack?! Open the Door, Dantemon!
Chou Kyodai Cometmon Shuurai!? Tobira o Hirake, Dantemon!
episode.summary: It`s time to put the Seven Code Chips into the Seven Code Pad and summon Dantemon! But what`s that thing coming down from the sky?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: とりもどせセブンコードアプモン! 対決 極VS極!
Take Back the Seven Code Appmon! Ultimate Versus Ultimate!
Torimodose Seven Code Appmon! Taiketsu: Kyoku vs Kyoku!
episode.summary: The team can`t reach the deep web until they take back Weatherdramon! As they race to retrieve the stolen chip from Mienumon, she too undergoes an App Fusion with an Ultimate Appmon! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: お前の力を俺に貸せ レイとハックモン, あの日の出会い
Share Your Power with Me. The Meeting of Rei and Hackmon.
Omae no Chikara o Ore ni Kase: Rei to Hackmon, Ano Hi no Deai
episode.summary: Two years ago, Rei was spending sleepless hours searching for his brother trapped in the sea of the `net. But just as he caught Leviathan`s trail, he ended up in danger of being hacked himself! Just then... Hackmon appeared! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: トップアイドルへの道! コーチモンの猛特訓!
The Road to Be Top Idol! Coachmon`s Brutal Training!
Top Idol e no Michi! Coachmon no Moutokkun!
episode.summary: Eri wants to become one of the selected members of Appliyama 470! To pass the audition, she undergoes strict training under Coachmon`s tutelage! But is Coachmon secretly working for Leviathan?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ついに潜入ディープウェブ! 謎のサイバー九龍!
Into the Deep Web at Last! The Mysterious Cyber Kowloon!
Tsui ni Sennyuu Deep Web! Nazo no Cyber Kyuu Ryuu!
episode.summary: With the Seven Code Bands in hand, Haru and the others dive into the deep web! In Leviathan-controlled Cyber Kowloon, they manage to save Drawmon from a data-destroying program worm, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アプリドライヴDUO! オフモンあらわる
App Drive Duo! Offmon Appears!
Appli-Drive Duo! Offmon Arawaru
episode.summary: The battle with Sateramon is going south fast! But the one who comes to save them is Yujin, who`s partnered with Offmon and uses the powerful App Drive Duo! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 五人目のアプリドライヴァー!
The Fifth App Driver!
Gonin Me no Appli-Driver!
episode.summary: Eri`s decided to start using Appter. But it starts producing tweets without her knowledge... Meanwhile, a powerful Leviathan assassin attacks the team! Who will appear to save them in their most dangerous hour?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ボクが主人公!? ガッチモンとの出会い
I`m a Protagonist?! My First Meeting with Gatchmon!
Boku ga Shujinkou!? Gacchimon to no Deai
episode.summary: The mystery of Leviathan is close to being solved! Time to look back on how Haru and the others met, and the hardest battles they`ve faced, while steeling our nerves to face off against Leviathan! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Ending 3
Opening 2
みんなで連れ出せ! 引きこもりのオフモン!
Let`s Draw Him Out Together! Offmon the Shut-in!
Minna de Tsuredase! Hikikomori no Offmon!
episode.summary: Traumatized after injuring Yujin`s, Offmon shuts himself away from the team. Haru and the others try to devise different strategies to get him to come back out. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 旅は道連れ!? トリップモンの恐怖トリップ
Travel Is About Companions?! Tripmon`s Trip of Terror!
Tabi wa Michizure!? Trippmon no Kyoufu Trip
episode.summary: The App Driver team heads to a hot springs, but their travel app takes them to a creepy traditional inn instead! The scenery is scary and they get soaked to the bone... Something`s got to be wrong here! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ドカモンの恋!? グルメアプリ・マリペロ襲来!
Dokamon in Love?! Dining App Maripero Attacks!
Dokamon no Koi!? Gourmet Appli Maripero Shuurai!
episode.summary: Eri`s become a true master food reviewer! The female Perorimon, Maripero, comes to Eri to learn her secrets! But why does Dokamon have to look after her, then?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バディ解消!? ガッチモンの家出
Buddies No More? Gatchmon Leaves Home!
Buddy Kaishou!!? Gacchimon no Iede
episode.summary: Everyone`s crazy about Offmon! Gatchmon is sulking about it, and decides to flee the secret base in Apprealized form! Dokamon and Musimon decide to run away with him too... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 総選挙決着! エリに迫る魔の手!
The Election Results! Evil`s Clutches Reach for Eri!
Sousenkyo Kecchaku! Eri ni Semaru Ma no Te!
episode.summary: At last, the Appliyama 470 election results are revealed! Who will take #1? Who will be the new Nine Goddesses? Could Eri be one of them?! Meanwhile, Rei and Hackmon infiltrate L-Corp to investigate some mysterious video data! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: めざせ9人ゴッド! アプリ山470総選挙!
Become One of the Nine Goddesses! The Appliyama 470 Elections!
Mezase 9 Nin God! Appli Yama 470 Sousenkyo!
episode.summary: It`s time for Appliyama 470`s biggest event, the ranking vote! Eri`s working her hardest to take the number one spot, but when the preliminary results come out, she gets the surprise of a lifetime! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: サンキュー未来! 人工知能の街へようこそ!
Thank You, Future! Welcome to the AI City!
Thank You Mirai! Jinkouchinou no Machi e Youkoso!
episode.summary: Massive corporation L-Corp doesn`t just create smartphone OSes and home electronics, they also sponsor Appliyama 470... and they`ve created a city run by artificial intelligence, which the whole gang gets to go see! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 高校生CEO! 雲龍寺ナイトあらわる!
The Teen CEO! Unryuji Knight Appears!
Koukousei CEO! Unryuuji Knight Arawaru!
episode.summary: To find his little brother Hajime, Rei and Hackmon dive back into the deep web. While searching for clues, they infiltrate the important individuals data center to steal top-secret information, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アルティメット4再び! クラウドの挑戦状!
The Return of the Ultimate Four! Cloud`s Challenge!
Ultimate 4 Futatabi! Cloud no Chousenjou!
episode.summary: The rest of the team leave Rei and Hackmon to face Biomon as they race forward, but Eri and Dokamon are confronted by Beautymon, and Torajiro and Musimon are stopped by Fakemon! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新たな力! アプリドライヴDUO!
A New Power: The App Drive Duo!
Arata na Chikara! App Drive Duo!
episode.summary: With the help of Deneimon, Haru and the others acquire App Drive Duos, and head to the Appmon Graveyard to save Yujin! What is the secret power hidden inside their new Drives?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ガッチモンを取り戻せ! 電衛門じいちゃんの試練!
Take Back Gatchmon! Grandpa Deneimon`s Test!
Gacchimon o Torimodose! Den`emon Jii-chan no Shiren!
episode.summary: Yujin is captured by the Ultimate Four, and the App Drives are destroyed, meaning Gatchmon and the others are all gone! Haru is feeling adrift, when suddenly, he hears a voice from an unexpected place... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 襲来! 極アプモン・アルティメット4!
Attack! The Appmon Ultimate Four!
Shuurai! Goku Upmon Ultimate 4!
episode.summary: Haru and the others have saved Eri, but they`re confronted by the Ultimate Four Appmon! The team Ultimate Apprealize all their Appmon to face them, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Ending 4
極限の激闘! グローブモンVSカリスモン!
The Ultimate Clash! Globemon Versus Charismon!
Kyokugen no Gekitou! Globemon VS Charmon!
episode.summary: Haru arrives at Charisma Castle, where Yujin is being held by Leviathan. There, he faces off with the strongest of the Ultimate Four, Charismon, and learns the true identity of the sinister Cloud! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 逃亡者・ブートモンを追え!
Catch the Runaway Bootmon!
Toubousha Buutomon o Oe!
episode.summary: Hajime, finally himself again, learns of Operation: Human Applications, a plan to turn all of humanity into easily-regulated data. And the key to stopping Leviathan`s terrible plan is... Bootmon?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 目覚めろ, スリープモン! アプモン選手権再び!!
Wake Up, Sleepmon! Return of the Appmon Championship!
Mezamero, Sleepmon! Appmon Senshuken Futatabi!!
episode.summary: Let`s see who can get Sleepmon to wake up first! The Appmon try all different kinds of tactics, but Sleepmon shows no sign of waking, so... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: レイの決意! はじめ捜索大作戦!
Rei`s Determination! The Plan to Take Back Hajime!
Rei no Ketsui! Hajime Sousaku Daisakusen!
episode.summary: Rei has found a clue about Hajime`s whereabouts. Though Eri is thinking of quitting Appliyama because of L-Corp`s new CEO, he gets her to agree to let him disguise as her manager to infiltrate the company. But what is his plan?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 起動! 人類アプリ化計画!
Activate! Operation: Human Applications!
Kidou! Jinrui Appli Kakeikaku!
episode.summary: Just as things seemed to be working out, Yujin revealed his terrible secret: he was a Leviathan-created AI all along! Bootmon is evolved into a more advanced form, and the God-grades are released... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 勇仁の真実
The Truth About Yujin
Yuujin no Shinjitsu
episode.summary: Bootmon keeps running away with his emergency evacuation program! The team completes a special program which lets Haru finally make contact... but just then, Yujin starts acting strangely... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 星空の誓い! アストラ救出大作戦!
The Starry Sky Promise! The Great Astora Escape Plan!
Hoshizora no Chikai! Asutora Kyuushutsu Daisakusen!
episode.summary: Astora is determined to stream a meteor shower live for a special fan in the hospital, but he`s ambushed and sent to live at an inescapable temple complex. Time for the team to run a jailbreak! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大激突!? ガッチモンVSアグモン!
Collision?! Gatchmon Versus Agumon!
Daigekitou!? Gacchimon vs Agumon!
episode.summary: Video game characters are causing chaos in IOT devices everywhere! Haru finds that a common link behind the rampages is a character from a monster-raising RPG he played as a child... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ボクたちのシンギュラリティー
Our Singularity
Bokutachi no Singularity
episode.summary: It`s finally time for the showdown with Leviathan, and to show him Haru and Gatchmon`s buddy power! The App Drivers will all stand up to ensure humanity`s future! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 人工知能の見る夢
The Artificial Intelligence`s Dream
Jinkouchinou no Miru Yume
episode.summary: More and more people are bathed in Leviathan`s light, and turned into apps. Leviathan has also consumed the God Appmon to install them into himself. Can he be stopped?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 希望の絆! ハルとガイアモン!!
Bonds of Hope! Haru and Gaiamon!!
Kibou no Kizuna! Haru to Gaeamon!!
episode.summary: A massive shadow appears in the skies and throws the city into chaos! Who would have thought Leviathan would apprealize, too? Haru gets the Gaiamon chip, but can he bring back his best friend Yujin? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 奇跡の最終進化! 神アプモン降臨!
The Miraculous Final Evolution! The God Appmon Descend!
Kiseki no Saishuu Shinka! Kami Appmon Kourin!
episode.summary: Leviathan initiates Operation: Human Applications, and little by little, the people of the world are converted into apps. Eri, Astora, and Rei apprealize their God Appmon to try to defeat Deusmon! Source: crunchyroll
